disease: Malignant neoplasm of connective and soft tissue of left upper limb, including shoulder

symptoms.name: Limited abduction of left upper limb

vital_signs.N/A: No abnormal vital signs explicitly mentioned

physical_findings: Left shoulder joint in forced adduction
Obvious swelling and tenderness on the lateral and anterior sides of the left shoulder

imaging_findings.Radiography: Linear low-density shadow at the greater tuberosity of the left humerus and small low-density flakes in the upper medullary cavity of the left humerus
imaging_findings.CT: Soft tissue mass in the left shoulder with strip-like calcifications; cortical edge and marrow cavity invasion; insect-like zone of destruction; needle-like periosteal reaction; multiple small nodules beneath the pleura of both lungs
imaging_findings.MRI: Huge mass (10.3 cm × 10.5 cm × 13.6 cm) surrounding the left humeral head and proximal shaft of humerus; mixed moderate hypointensity and hyperintensity on T1-weighted images; mixed hyperintensity on coronal fat-saturated T2-weighted images; heterogeneous enhancement with contrast; discontinuous humeral cortex; worm-eaten-like bone destruction; irregular patches of hypointensity on coronal T1-weighted images and mixed hyperintensity on fat-saturated T2-weighted images
imaging_findings.Bone scan: Increased activity in the left shoulder joint and proximal humerus

required: Imaging findings consistent with a soft tissue mass in the left upper limb, including the shoulder
Histopathological confirmation of malignant neoplasm of connective and soft tissue
supportive: Clinical symptoms of pain and swelling

differential_diagnoses: Giant cell tumor of soft tissue (GCT-ST)
